required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Outcomes After Conversion to Belatacept
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Outcomes After Conversion to a Belatacept-based Immunosuppression in Kidney Transplant

lead_sponsor.agency: Paris Translational Research Center for Organ Transplantation

clinical_study.source: Paris Translational Research Center for Organ Transplantation

brief_summary.textblock: belatacept is a selective T-cell co-stimulation blocker that was approved by Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in 2011 for the prophylaxis of graft rejection in adult kidney transplant recipients. This treatment is indicated as an alternative to Calcineurin Inhibitors (CNIs) for prophylaxis of graft rejection in de novo renal transplant recipients. Long term efficacy and safety outcomes of a kidney transplant population converted to a belatacept regimen after transplant have not been yet reported.

detailed_description.textblock:
belatacept is a selective T-cell co-stimulation blocker that was approved by Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in 2011 for the prophylaxis of graft rejection in adult kidney transplant recipients. This treatment is indicated as an alternative to Calcineurin Inhibitors (CNIs) for prophylaxis of graft rejection in de novo renal transplant recipients. Major studies evaluating belatacept showed that de novo kidney transplant patients treated with belatacept presented an improved renal function with a higher average estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) compared to ciclosporin (CsA) regimen in patients. Conversion to belatacept after transplant seems to be safe even in highly sensitized patients. However, long term efficacy and safety outcomes of a kidney transplant population converted to a belatacept regimen after transplant and compared to a matched control group under a CNIs regimen have not been yet reported.
A multicenter cohort of kidney transplant patients, will be use to match patients converted to a belatacept immunosuppressive regimen to a control group under CNIs immunosuppressive regimen.

primary_outcome.measure: Allograft survival after conversion to belatacept
primary_outcome.description: Graft loss is defined as either functional loss or physical loss (nephrectomy). Functional loss is defined as an eGFR< 15 ml/min/1.73m2 or consecutive days of dialysis. For patients who died with a functioning graft, graft survival will be censored at the time of death as a survived or functional graft.

primary_outcome.measure: Patient survival after conversion to belatacept
primary_outcome.description: Patient survival after conversion to a belatacept regimen

arm_group.arm_group_label: converted to a belatacept based immunosuppression
arm_group.description: Belatacept: infusion on Days 1, 15, 29, 43, 57 then every 28 days. All patients received a background maintenance immunosuppressive regimen of mycophenolate mofetil or mycophenolic acid, with adjunctive corticosteroids, according to their immunosuppressive regimen at the time of enrollment.

intervention.description: belatacept intravenous on Days 1, 15, 29, 43, 57 then every 28 days.
intervention.arm_group_label: converted to a belatacept based immunosuppression

study_pop.textblock: Patients converted to a belatacept regimen after kidney transplant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or Female, over 18 years of age
- Recipient of kidney allograft from a living donor or a deceased donor
Exclusion Criteria:
- Graft loss during the first three months post-transplant
- Epstein-Barr virus Seronegative in the belatacept group

overall_official.affiliation: Paris Translational Research Center for Organ Transplantation
